intro: Oryzopsis florulenta, commonly known as the golden grass, is a perennial grass species native to the warmer regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, blade-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. Oryzopsis florulenta thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a common sight in open fields and along riverbanks. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
